page.title: 06ST.JOHNS CHAPEL MART (3)
page.content: When the farmers made their bids they did it in different ways. Some put their hands up , some touched their noses and some raised their sticks. We saw some cows sold for Â£300. St Johns Chapel Mart was established in 1896. There are 11 marts in a year. The stock sold at the mart are cattle and sheep. The two biggest sales are the Pedigree and Swaledale Ram sale and the Store Cattle and Suckler Calf sale. The biggest sales start at about 10am and finish at about 7pm. The smaller sales last approximately 4 hours. There are about 5 part time workers at the mart. Mr. Peart has been auctioneer for nearly 20 years. From time to time there are also sales of household goods.
